sentences: Kõik vangid said hommikusöögiks leiba ja suppi.
Politsei vahistas kolm venda kui kurjategijaid.
context: The word 'vangid' is the plural form of 'vangi', which means 'prisoner' in English. It refers to people who have been imprisoned or incarcerated as punishment for crimes they've committed. In Estonian, this word follows standard plural formation rules where the singular ending '-i' becomes '-id' in plural.
